top_comments_top.body:
Hello and welcome to r/LifeProTips!

Please help us decide if this post is a good fit for the subreddit by up or downvoting this comment. 

If you think that this is great advice to improve your life, please upvote. If you think this doesn't help you in any way, please downvote. If you don't care, leave it for the others to decide.

I’m saying this as someone with chronic illness & disability - at some point you have to grow some balls and learn to tell people no.

Or you allow them to come for 2 hours and do x, y, & z tasks, then leave. 

You’re in control. Learning to say no is an important life lesson.
I've seen several LPT's about visiting. Can we all just agree it's never okay to announce your visiting? You should always ask.
I'd talk to my husband. Most of this is on you though. You not wanting to offend is damaging your own health.
